caption: Table 1: List of all notations for Non-stationary Multi-arms bandit.
description: This table lists notations used in the paper for non-stationary multi-armed bandits.  It defines variables representing the number of arms, number of visitations at each arm, the mean value of each arm, the optimal action, the mean value of the optimal arm, the power mean estimator, and the mean estimator of an arm after n visitations.  These notations are used in the theoretical analysis of the CATS and PATS algorithms within the non-stationary multi-armed bandit framework.

caption: Table 3: Average scores in Atari with 512 samples (10 seeds) ± 2 times std.
description: This table presents the average scores achieved by different algorithms (CATS, PATS, UCT, DQN, Power-UCT, TENTS, MENTS) on 17 Atari games.  The results are averaged over 10 runs with 512 samples each, and error bars represent ±2 times the standard deviation.  The table allows for a comparison of the performance of the proposed distributional Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS) algorithms (CATS and PATS) against existing methods on a commonly used benchmark in reinforcement learning.

caption: Table 3: Average scores in Atari with 512 samples (10 seeds) ± 2 times std.
description: This table presents the average scores achieved by different algorithms (CATS, PATS, UCT, DQN, Power-UCT, TENTS, and MENTS) on 17 different Atari games.  The scores represent the average performance over 10 runs, each with 512 samples, and include ±2 times the standard deviation to indicate variability.  This allows for comparison of the performance of the proposed distributional planning methods (CATS and PATS) against existing state-of-the-art methods.

caption: Table 4: The hyperparameter \(\tau\) (temperature) for MENTS and TENTS in Atari.
description: This table shows the optimal temperature parameter \(\tau\) used for the MENTS and TENTS algorithms in each of the 17 Atari games tested.  These parameters were obtained through hyperparameter tuning and are specific to the experimental setup described in the paper.
